meanings.definition: A large, shaggy-haired wild ox native to North America and Europe.
meanings.sent1: The bison roamed freely across the grasslands.
meanings.sent2: The bison herd grazed peacefully in the valley.
meanings.sent3: The bison told jokes to the buffalo for a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: The strength of the bison was like a mountain in motion.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bison charging through the plains stayed in my mind.

meanings.definition: The flesh of the bison used as food.
meanings.sent1: Grilled bison meat is a lean and healthy option.
meanings.sent2: The chef prepared a delicious bison steak for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The bison burger was so big, it needed two hands to hold.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of cooking bison filled the kitchen with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The taste of bison reminded me of the wild outdoors.

meanings.definition: A coin of Poland, equal to one hundredth of a zloty.
meanings.sent1: She found a bison in her pocket while counting coins.
meanings.sent2: The vending machine only accepted exact change, including bison.
meanings.sent3: The bison coin rolled away and caused a commotion in the market.
meanings.sent4: The shiny bison sparkled under the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The bison coin clinked against the others in the jar.
